Which insect can lift 50 times its weight?
Ant
How do snakes smell?
With their tongues
What % of snakes are venomous?
only around 20%
Both toxins, how is venom differ from poison?
Mode of delivery, venon is actively delivered by a bite or sting, while poison is passively done by consumption
Which bird is a symbol of peace?
Dove, which is why they are featured often in violent movie scenes as contrast
What is a runt?
A small baby animal
Can turtles leave their shells?
No, their shell is part of their skeleton
Which animal never sleeps?
The bullfrog, they only rest
Is bear cannivore?
No, bear is omnivore
What is a scavenger?
An animal that eats dead organisms (e.g., vulture)
What do koalas eat?
Eucalyptus leaves
Where would you find a walrus?
In the Arctic
Which biome has the most biodiversity?
Tropical rainforest
What is migration?
Seasonal movement for more suitable habitat
Apart from bats, what animal uses echolocation?
Dolphins
Why do fireflies glow?
To attract mates through bioluminescence
How do camels survive in deserts?
By storing fat in humps
What is the largest animal on Earth?
The blue whale
Name four main groups of vertebrates out of the five
Mammals, birds, reptiles, amphibians, fish
What is an arthropod?
An invertebrate animal with exoskeletons, segments and jointed limbs. They are the larguest group of animals, including insect, spider, crustacean etc
How are insect and arachnid defined
insect: 6 legs, 3 body segments, with antennae / arachnid: 8 legs, 2 body segments, no antennae
How do bees make honey?
By regurgitating nectar and evaporating water.
Why do some animals regurgitate food?
For re-consumption, digestion, or feeding others
Apart from being a large white seabird, albatross also means
a source of frustration or guilt, (money was the albatross of their marriage)
What is the deadliest animal to humans?
Mosquito for their diseases spreading, like malaria
Name three deadly spiders in Australia
funnel-web / redback / mouse spider / tarantula / huntsman spider
Who introduced the theory of natural selection, ie evolution?
Charles Darwin
What is the most unique fact about seahorse?
the male carries the fertilized eggs.
What is metamorphosis?
Abrupt change of physical form in animals, like butterfly, frog
Which animal is often used to describe fatal attraction?
Like a moth to a flame
